WorkItem.Description:
Currently typescript uses the __"Script Identifier"__ color for both vars and types. When you rollover a var, typescript clearly knows its a "var" definition. When you rollover a type, typescript knows its a "class" definition. Vars and classes should use different colors.

There should be 2 settings in VS, __"Script Type"__ and __"Script Identifier"__ for these, and syntax highlighting should use these colors when coloring the page.

If a 3rd setting could be added for functions : __"Script Function"__, and used for function definitions and function calls it would be really amazing.

![Image](http://i49.tinypic.com/2ln90fd.jpg)

As you can see "number" is the "Keyword" color, which is fine, but BigInt is defined as a "interface BigInt" and should be another color.
WorkItem.Summary: Both vars and classes use the same color making it confusing
